messages.message:
Thinking about ways to introduce AI and automation into our vulnerability management (and general attack management), a colleague of mine runs this service:

Have any of you had personal experience with it before? Just like an eng pipeline, it's the equivalent of CI/CD but for vuln management (and managing attacks as well)

Also fyi - @Chris, @thomas.pirog

https://www.praetorian.com/

@Jason - Thinking about your buy/build comments in the all-hands, this would be another example of it I think.

On certain components, the ROI on buying can be significantly better than building, particularly from scratch.
I've started to spend my days going through BVAs with a few vendors.
I really like praetorian.com (http://praetorian.com) and the solutions they offer. Have you run into them before? They work with some fairly large companies if I recall. (netflix, google, amazon(?))
We definitely build a lot of products that we don't sell, so this seems like a win if the product solves our needs
